cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 25 mi (40 km) NE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island

motion.direction: Nearly stationary (slow WNW expected to resume)

cyclone.trajectory: Expected to move slowly WNW overnight, then turn northwest Tuesday, and begin a northeastward acceleration Wednesday night–Friday while paralleling the Southeast U.S. coastline and then moving into the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: closest approach/possible coastal scrape near the South Carolina–North Carolina coast (around Cape Hatteras)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: North of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL and North of Ponte Vedra Beach FL to South Santee River SC; Tropical Storm Watch: North of Golden Beach FL to Deerfield Beach FL and Lake Okeechobee
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: Jupiter Inlet FL to Ponte Vedra Beach FL; Storm Surge Warning: Lantana FL to Altamaha Sound GA; Tropical Storm Warning: North of Deerfield Beach FL to Jupiter Inlet FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coast from Florida through Georgia and South Carolina northward to North Carolina and southeastern Virginia, then offshore toward the Mid-Atlantic
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (current guidance suggests 2–4 inches in southeastern Virginia)
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Unlikely (main surge threat focuses south of Virginia; minor 1–3 ft coastal inundation possible)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 kt) possible Friday with gusts higher in squalls
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal flooding 1–3 ft above ground level possible at times of high tide
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy rain with totals generally 2–4 inches; localized higher amounts cannot be ruled out in outer rain-bands
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf, high waves, and rip currents which may disrupt vessel traffic and cargo operations
